alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 2:05PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Cheyenne County in east central Colorado through 245 PM MDT... At 204 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles west of Kit Carson, or 33 miles west of Cheyenne Wells. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Torrential rainfall, wind gusts up to 45 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Torrential rainfall with this storm may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Cheyenne County in east central Colorado, including the following locations... Wild Horse. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
